frameDefinitions: This frame concerns the appointment of a New_leader or removal from office of an Old_leader.
A former Member of a Group ceases to be a member as a result of the action of an Authority within the Group.

This frame deals with a Speaker communicating a reply or response, a Message, to some prior communication or action, the Trigger.  '' 'The landlord has not yet replied in writing to the tenant objecting the proposed alterations.
A Speaker declares that they will no longer be involved with the Content.
Partner_1 interacts with Partner_2 (also collectively expressible as Partners) to change their social relationship.
An Agent changes the filler of a  Role by placing a New filler in the position after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
frameExamples: On March 17 , Mamedov <t>appointed</t> Rakhim Gasiyev as Defence Minister .
The priest <t>excommunicated</t> Henry from the church.
The landlord has not yet <t>replied</t> in writing to the tenant objecting the proposed alterations.DNI
That will only be possible if and when the IRA <t>renounces</t> armed struggle.
I <t>befriended</t> the little pony by giving him a piece of apple.
If you <t>replace</t> me with a robot, who's gonna make excuses to your wife for you?
listRoleDefinitions: The Selector (most commonly a group of people) is responsible for a change in leadership.  Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.

With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the <fen>Old_leader</fen> is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition <ment>against</ment>.
With words denoting appointment to a position, the <fen>New_leader</fen> is typically the object of verbs.

Frequently the <fen>Old_leader</fen> or <fen>New_leader</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement.
The role <fen>Old_order</fen> identifies the political order that existed before the change of leadership occurs.
The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>New_leader</fen> will fufill.
A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function of governance.
When the change takes place.
Where the change takes place.
The person who used to belong to a <fen>Group</fen>.
A set of people standing in a semi-permanent relationship together.
An empowered subset of the <fen>Group</fen> which decides to expel its former <fen>Member</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Member</fen> is excluded.
The Place where the <fen>Member</fen> is excluded.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that communicates the reply or response. It is expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of a <t>Target</t> verb or as the Genitive modifier of a <t>Target</t> noun:
This is the person to whom the response is communicated.  When expressed, this role occurs as the direct object of a <t>Target</t> verb, or in a prepositional phrase introduced by 'to':
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a direct quote or a clause.
<fen>Topic</fen> occurs quite rarely in this frame and usually only as a PP Complement of a noun <t>Target</t>:
The <fen>Trigger</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given. It can occur as an NP Object or a PP Complement.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  makes a verbal response.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who communicates their cessation of association with the <fen>Content</fen>.
The idea that the <fen>Speaker</fen> no longer associates with, whether it be an activity, a propostion, or a group.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement of renunciation.
The time when the statement is made.
The role specifies the place where the statement takes place.
The individual who comes to form a relationship with Partner_2.
The individual whose relationship with <fen>Partner_1</fen> changes.
The individuals whose relationship is changing.
The time when the relationship changes.
Where the relationship is formed.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs actions resulting in the <fen>New</fen> entity occupying the position.
The <fen>New</fen> entity is the person or thing that the <fen>Agent</fen> sets to fill a <fen>Role</fen>.
The entity that formerly occupied the position.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> installs the New entity.
This role identifies where the <fen>Agent</fen> installs the <fen>New</fen> entity.

The students overthrew <fex>the president</fex>.
The president appoints <fex>the prime minister</fex>.
The board of directors appointed Ashton <fex>Acting President</fex>.
The rebels overthrew <fex>the dictatorship</fex>.
His district elected her  <fex>to Congress</fex> three times.
The <fex>2000</fex> coup against the dictator was led by former president Smith.
The crew mutinied <fex>out in the middle of the Atlantic</fex>, the scoundrels.
I 'm afraid that <fex>I</fex> was expelled from the Society after they found I endorsed him.
Giles bemoaned his expulsion <fex>from the Future Farmers of America</fex>
<fex>Sue</fex> responded to the objection convincingly.
Sue answered <fex>Bob</fex> immediately.
<fex>'I can't help you,'</fex> Sue answered.
My boss still hasn't given me an answer <fex>about a promotion</fex>.
Sue answered <fex>the question</fex>.
A reminder letter was sent to all nonrespondents who had not replied <fex>after 28 days</fex>.
This was how Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa responded <fex>in the Assembly</fex> on November 5, 2003.
Bonnie Charlie then renounced <fex>his aspirations to the throne</fex>.
Castro renounced all involvement with the group <fex>over the radio</fex>.
She married Stephen <fex>last summer</fex>.
We married <fex>in a gazebo</fex>.
I don't know; perhaps you could substitute <fex>regular sugar</fex>.
If you substitute a 15' arm <fex>for the 50cm one</fex>, it works pretty well.
